name: pdftoipe
description: Reads arbitrary PDF files and generates an XML file readable by Ipe

repo.name: ipe-tools
repo.description: Tools to use with the Ipe drawing editor

readme.summary: Clear purpose but completely lacks installation instructions, usage examples, and any practical guidance for actually using the tool.
readme.top_issue: No installation instructions whatsoever - users cannot determine how to build, install, or run pdftoipe

injection_risks.description: The use of os.system with user input (outfile) can lead to command injection attacks.
The use of string formatting with user input (pdffile) can potentially lead to path traversal or other issues if not properly sanitized.

critical_findings: Lack of input validation and sanitization in annotate.py
security.summary: The code has significant security concerns, including command injection vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, which can be exploited by attackers to gain unauthorized access or execute malicious commands.

common_complaints: Dependency version incompatibilities (Poppler API breaking changes)
Matplotlib backend broken with newer versions (missing imports, API changes)
Compilation failures due to outdated code
Image handling bugs (indexed images not supported)
sentiment.summary: Severely degraded community health: persistent unresolved dependency incompatibilities, broken backends, and unresponsive maintenance indicate the project is effectively abandoned with no active development.

red_flags: unwillingness to help with basic questions
redirecting users to other resources without assistance
communication.summary: The maintainer provides technically sound responses, but can be abrupt and unhelpful when dealing with basic or repeated questions.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2026-01-08)
5 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
No closed issues in past 6 months indicating lack of maintenance activity
No merged PRs in past 6 months showing no development progress
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date prevents assessment of release cadence
positive_signals: Recent commit activity exists (2026-01-08), suggesting project is not completely abandoned
maintenance.summary: The project shows signs of stagnation with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite a recent commit, indicated by zero merged PRs, closed issues, and active contributors.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation provides a good overview of the package's features and tools, but lacks clear installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Docs: Lack of clear installation instructions
Community: compatibility issues with matplotlib and poppler
Communication: unwillingness to help with basic questions
Communication: redirecting users to other resources without assistance

Security: Lack of input validation and sanitization in annotate.py
